alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:07AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Butler, Monroe, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington, southeastern Clarke, western Escambia, southeastern Wilcox, Conecuh and northwestern Escambia Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 207 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Vredenburgh to 11 miles northwest of Frisco City to 12 miles southeast of Jackson to Calvert. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atmore, Monroeville, Evergreen, Camden, Frisco City, McCullough, Peterman, Uriah, Calvert, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Repton, Pine Apple, I65 And US 84, Bratt, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 113 and I65 And AL 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama.
